member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode
member.summary: Error code enumeration, indicating the type of the error.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.Unknown
member.summary: Unrecognized error code. It usually indicates incompatibility between the authentication server and client SDK versions.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.SessionClosed
member.summary: Session has been closed (no error).

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.OtherSessionError
member.summary: Other session level error has occurred.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.AccessTokenExpired
member.summary: Access token has already expired.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.BadUserAuthentication

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.NoSuchRealm
member.summary: Path points to non-existing Realm.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.PermissionDenied
member.summary: Permission to Realm has been denied.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.BadServerFileIdentifier
member.summary: The server file identifier is invalid.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.BadClientFileIdentifier
member.summary: The client file identifier is invalid.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.BadServerVersion
member.summary: The server version is invalid.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.BadClientVersion
member.summary: The client version is invalid.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.DivergingHistories
member.summary: Histories have diverged and cannot be merged.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.BadChangeset
member.summary: The changeset is invalid.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.DisabledSession
member.summary: The session has been disabled.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.InvalidParameters
member.summary: Your request parameters did not validate.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.MissingParameters
member.summary: Your request did not validate because of missing parameters.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.InvalidCredentials
member.summary: The provided credentials are invalid.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.UnknownAccount
member.summary: The account does not exist.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.ExistingAccount
member.summary: The account cannot be registered as it exists already.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.AccessDenied
member.summary: The path is invalid or current user has no access.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.ExpiredRefreshToken
member.summary: The refresh token is expired.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.InvalidHost
member.summary: The server is not authoritative for this URL.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.ExpiredPermissionOffer
member.summary: The permission offer is expired.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.AmbiguousPermissionOfferToken
member.summary: The token used on the permission request does match more than a single permission offer.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode.FileMayNotBeShared
member.summary: The Realm file at the specified path is not available for shared access.

true if the user should be created, false otherwise. It is not possible to create a user twice when logging in, so this flag should only be set to true the first time a user logs in.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Session
member.summary: An object encapsulating a Realm Object Server session. Sessions represent the communication between the client (and a local Realm file on disk), and the server (and a remote Realm at a given URL stored on a Realm Object Server). Sessions are always created by the SDK and vended out through various APIs. The lifespans of sessions associated with Realms are managed automatically.

member.name: E:Realms.Sync.Session.Error
member.summary: Triggered when an error occurs on a session. The sender argument will be the session which has errored.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Session.ServerUri
member.summary: Gets the describing the remote Realm which this session connects to and synchronizes changes with.
member.value: The where the Realm Object Server resides.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Session.State
member.summary: Gets the sessionâ€™s current state.
member.value: An enum value indicating the state of the session.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Session.User
member.summary: Gets the defined by the that is used to connect to the Realm Object Server.
member.value: The that was used to create the 's .

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Session.GetProgressObservable(Realms.Sync.ProgressDirection,Realms.Sync.ProgressMode)
member.summary: Gets an that can be used to track upload or download progress.
member.remarks: To start receiving notifications, you should call on the returned object. The token returned from should be retained as long as progress notifications are desired. To stop receiving notifications, call on the token. You don't need to keep a reference to the observable itself. The progress callback will always be called once immediately upon subscribing in order to provide the latest available status information.
member.returns: An observable that you can subscribe to and receive progress updates.
member.param: The transfer direction (upload or download) to track in the subscription callback.
The desired behavior of this progress notification block.

member.summary: Gets the used to create this .

member.summary: Gets the used to create this .
member.value: The whose s will be synced.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.SyncConfiguration.#ctor(Realms.Sync.User,System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A valid .
A unique that identifies the Realm. In URIs, ~ can be used as a placeholder for a user Id.
Path to the realm, must be a valid full path for the current platform, relative subdirectory, or just filename.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.User
member.summary: This class represents a user on the Realm Object Server. The credentials are provided by various 3rd party providers (Facebook, Google, etc.). A user can log in to the Realm Object Server, and if access is granted, it is possible to synchronize the local and the remote Realm. Moreover, synchronization is halted when the user is logged out. It is possible to persist a user. By retrieving a user, there is no need to log in to the 3rd party provider again. Persisting a user between sessions, the user's credentials are stored locally on the device, and should be treated as sensitive data.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.User.Current
member.summary: Gets the currently logged-in user. If none exists, null is returned. If more than one user is currently logged in, an exception is thrown.
member.value: Valid user or null to indicate nobody logged in.
member.exception: Thrown if there are more than one users logged in.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.User.AllLoggedIn
member.summary: Gets all currently logged in users.
member.value: An array of valid logged in users.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.User.LoginAsync(Realms.Sync.Credentials,System.Uri)
member.summary: Logs the user in to the Realm Object Server.
member.param: The credentials to use for authentication.
The URI of the server that the user is authenticated against.
member.returns: An awaitable Task, that, upon completion, contains the logged in user.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.User.ConfigurePersistence(Realms.Sync.UserPersistenceMode,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configures user persistence. If you need to call this, be sure to do so before accessing any other Realm API.
member.param: The persistence mode.
The key to encrypt the persistent user store with.
If set to true reset the persistent user store on error.
member.remarks:
Users are persisted in a realm file within the application's sandbox.
By default objects are persisted and are additionally protected with an encryption key stored in the iOS Keychain when running on an iOS device (but not on a Simulator). On Android users are persisted in plaintext, because the AndroidKeyStore API is only supported on API level 18 and up. You might want to provide your own encryption key on Android or disable persistence for security reasons.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.User.RefreshToken
member.summary: Gets this user's refresh token. This is the user's credential for accessing the Realm Object Server and should be treated as sensitive data.
member.value: A unique string that can be used for refreshing the user's credentials.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.User.Identity
member.summary: Gets the identity of this user on the Realm Object Server. The identity is a guaranteed to be unique among all users on the Realm Object Server.
member.value: A string that uniquely identifies that user in Realm Object Server.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.User.ServerUri
member.summary: Gets the server that was used for authentication.
member.value: The used to connect to the authentication service.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.User.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of the user.
member.value: A value indicating whether the user is active, logged out, or an error has occurred.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.User.LogOut
member.summary: Logs out the user from the Realm Object Server. Once the Object Server has confirmed the logout the user credentials will be deleted from this device.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.IPermissionObject
member.summary: Interface that describes the shared base model of all Permission classes.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.IPermissionObject.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of this object in the Management realm.
member.value: The unique id of the object.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.IPermissionObject.CreatedAt
member.summary: Gets the creation time of this object.
member.value: A indicating the object's creation date and time.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.IPermissionObject.UpdatedAt
member.summary: Gets when the object was updated the last time.
member.remarks: This will be updated by the server with the current object when the object is processed.
member.value: A indicating the last time the object has been updated.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.IPermissionObject.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the if any.
member.remarks: Filled by the server after an object was processed indicating the status of the operation. If returns , the property can be used to get a strongly typed code for the error and handle expected error conditions, such as expired offer or attempting to share a realm without having manage access.
member.value: An that indicates the reason for the error during processing. null if no error has occurred or the object hasn't been processed yet.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.IPermissionObject.StatusMessage
member.summary: Gets the status message.
member.remarks: Filled by the server after an object was processed with additional info explaining the status if necessary.
member.value: A detailed message describing the status (success, error) of the operation. null if the object has not been processed yet.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.IPermissionObject.Status
member.summary: Gets the as set by the server.
member.value: An enum indicating whether the operation has completed successfully.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.PermissionChange
member.summary: Objects of this class allow to change permissions of owned Realms. They are created exclusively by the client and are processed by the server as indicated by the status fields.
member.remarks: objects allow to grant and revoke permissions by setting , and accordingly. If any of these flags are not set, these are merged with either the existing or default permissions as applicable. As a side-effect this causes that the default permissions are permanently materialized for the affected Realm files and the affected user. Once the request has been processed, the , , and will be updated accordingly.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionChange.UserId
member.summary: Gets the user or users to effect.
member.value: * to change the permissions for all users.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionChange.RealmUrl
member.summary: Gets the Realm to change permissions for.
member.value: * to change the permissions of all Realms.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionChange.MayRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user(s) have read access to the specified Realm(s).
member.value: true or false to request this new value. null to keep current value.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionChange.MayWrite
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user(s) have write access to the specified Realm(s).
member.value: true or false to request this new value. null to keep current value.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionChange.MayManage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user(s) have manage access to the specified Realm(s).
member.value: true or false to request this new value. null to keep current value.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.PermissionChange.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The user or users who should be granted these permission changes. Use * to change permissions for all users.
The Realm URL whose permissions settings should be changed. Use `*` to change the permissions of all Realms managed by the management Realm's .
Define read access. true or false to request this new value. null to keep current value.
Define write access. true or false to request this new value. null to keep current value.
Define manage access. true or false to request this new value. null to keep current value.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.UserPermissionsExtensions
member.summary: A set of extensions methods over the class that expose functionality for managing synchronized Realm permissions.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.UserPermissionsExtensions.GetManagementRealm(Realms.Sync.User)
member.summary: Returns an instance of the Management Realm owned by the user.
member.remarks: This Realm can be used to control access and permissions for Realms owned by the user. This includes giving other users access to Realms.
member.param: The user whose Management Realm to get.
member.returns: A Realm that can be used to control access and permissions for Realms owned by the user.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.UserPermissionsExtensions.GetPermissionRealm(Realms.Sync.User)
member.summary: Returns an instance of the Permission Realm owned by the user.
member.remarks: This Realm can be used to review access permissions for Realms managed by the user and to Realms which the user was granted access to by other users.
member.param: The user whose Permission Realm to get.
member.returns: A Realm that can be used to inspect access to other Realms.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.SessionState.Invalid

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.UserState

member.summary: The user is logged out. Call with valid credentials to log the user back in.

member.summary: The user is logged in, and any Realms associated with it are synchronizing with the Realm Object Server.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.UserState.Error
member.summary: The user has encountered a fatal error state, and cannot be used.

member.summary: The server has processed the request successfully.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ManagementObjectStatus.Error
member.summary: There was an error while processing the request. See for more details.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer
member.summary: Objects of this class are used to offer permissions to owned Realms. They are created exclusively by the client and are processed by the server as indicated by the status fields.
member.remarks: When offering permissions, you should create the offer and add it to the 's Management Realm. Then you should subscribe to to be notified when the server has processed the request. Once the request has been processed, the , , and will be updated accordingly. If the request has been processed successfully, the will be populated and you can share it with users you wish to grant permissions to. If the request has failed, the will be updated with relevant information about the failure and will be set to a non-null value.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer.Token
member.summary: Gets the token that can be used to offer the permissions defined in this object to another user.
member.value: A string, set by the server, that can be used to create a .

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer.RealmUrl
member.summary: Gets the url of the to offer permissions to.
member.value: The url of Realm.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer.MayRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the receiver of this offer will be able to read from the .
member.value: true to allow the receiver to read data from the .

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer.MayWrite
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the receiver of this offer will be able to write to the Realm.
member.value: true to allow the receiver to write data to the .

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer.MayManage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the receiver of this offer will be able to manage access rights for others.
member.value: true to allow the receiver to offer others access to the .

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer.ExpiresAt
member.summary: Gets or sets the expiration date and time of the offer.
member.value: If null, the offer will never expire. Otherwise, the offer may not be consumed past the expiration date.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Realm URL to offer permissions to.
If set to true grants read access.
If set to true grants write access.
If set to true grants manage access.
Optional expiration date of the offer. If set to null, the offer doesn't expire.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.PermissionOfferResponse
member.summary: Objects of this class are used to accept a using a provided .
member.remarks: Create an instance of using the provided and add it to the 's ManagementRealm. After that, you should subscribe to to be notified when the server processes the response. Once the request has been processed, the , , and will be updated accordingly. If the request has been processed successfully, the will be populated and you can use it to create a new . If the request has failed, the will be updated with relevant information about the failure and will be set to a non-null value.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionOfferResponse.Token
member.summary: Gets the token that was provided by the offering user.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionOfferResponse.RealmUrl
member.summary: Gets the url of the Realm that the token has granted permissions to.
member.remarks: Filled by the server after the was processed.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.PermissionOfferResponse.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The token that was provided by the offering user.

member.summary: Gets the Reason-Phrase of the HTTP response.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.HttpException.Payload

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.SyncProgress
member.summary: A struct containing information about the progress state at a given instant.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.SyncProgress.TransferredBytes
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes that have been transferred since subscribing for progress notifications.
member.value: The number of transferred bytes.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.SyncProgress.TransferableBytes
member.summary: Gets the total number of bytes that have to be transferred since subscribing for progress notifications. The difference between that number and gives you the number of bytes not yet transferred. If the difference is 0, then all changes at the instant the callback fires have been successfully transferred.
member.value: The number of transferable bytes.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.ProgressDirection
member.summary: The transfer direction (upload or download) tracked by a given progress notification subscription.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ProgressDirection.Upload
member.summary: Monitors upload progress.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ProgressDirection.Download
member.summary: Monitors download progress.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.ProgressMode
member.summary: The desired behavior of a progress notification subscription.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ProgressMode.ReportIndefinitely
member.summary: The callback will be called forever, or until it is unregistered by disposing the subscription token. Notifications will always report the latest number of transferred bytes, and the most up-to-date number of total transferable bytes.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ProgressMode.ForCurrentlyOutstandingWork
member.summary: The callback will, upon registration, store the total number of bytes to be transferred. When invoked, it will always report the most up-to-date number of transferable bytes out of that original number of transferable bytes. When the number of transferred bytes reaches or exceeds the number of transferable bytes, the callback will be unregistered.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.RealmSyncExtensions
member.summary: A set of extension methods that provide Sync-related functionality on top of Realm classes.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.RealmSyncExtensions.GetSession(Realms.Realm)
member.summary: Gets the for the realm file behind this .
member.returns: The that is responsible for synchronizing with a Realm Object Server instance.
member.param: An instance of the class created with a object.
member.exception: Thrown if realm was not created with a object.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Testing.TestingExtensions
member.summary: A set of extension methods to be used in unit-testing scenarios. Should not be used in production.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Testing.TestingExtensions.SimulateError(Realms.Sync.Session,Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ErrorCode,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Simulates a session error.
member.param: The session where the simulated error will occur.
Error code.
Error message.
If set to true the error will be marked as fatal.
member.remarks: Use this method to test your error handling code without connecting to a Realm Object Server. Some error codes, such as will be ignored and will not be reported to subscribers.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Testing.TestingExtensions.SimulateProgress(Realms.Sync.Session,System.UInt64,System.UInt64,System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Simulates a progress update.
member.param: Session which will report progress.
Downloaded bytes.
Downloadable bytes.
Uploaded bytes.
Uploadable bytes.
member.remarks: Use this method to test your progress handling code without connecting to a Realm Object Server. Some throttling may occur at a native level, so it is recommended to use Task.Delay() between invocations.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ClientResetException
member.summary: An exception describing a condition where a reset of the local Realm is required.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ClientResetException.BackupFilePath
member.summary: Gets the path where the backup copy of the realm will be placed once the client reset process is complete.
member.value: The path to the backup realm.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.ClientResetException.InitiateClientReset
member.summary: Initiates the client reset process.
member.returns: true if actions were run successfully, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Permission
member.summary: This model is used to reflect permissions granted to a user. It should be used in conjunction with a 's Permission Realm.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Permission.UpdatedAt
member.summary: Gets when the object was updated the last time.
member.value: A indicating the last time the object has been updated.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Permission.UserId
member.summary: Gets the identity of the user affected by this permission.
member.value: The user identity.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Permission.Path
member.summary: Gets the relative path to the Realm on the server.
member.value: A relative path component.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Permission.MayRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user inspecting that permission is allowed to read the Realm at the specified .
member.value: true if reading is allowed, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Permission.MayWrite
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user inspecting that permission is allowed to write to the Realm at the specified .
member.value: true if writing is allowed, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Permission.MayManage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user inspecting that permission is allowed to manage the permissions for the Realm at the specified .
member.value: true if managing is allowed, false otherwise.
